test.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a set of questions, exercises, or practical activities to measure someone’s skill, ability, or knowledge
test.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Did you get a good mark in the test?
We have a test on irregular verbs tomorrow.
test.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a medical examination on a part of your body, or a substance taken from your body, to check your health or to discover what is wrong with you
test.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The doctor said I needed to have a blood test.
I’m still waiting for my test results from the hospital.
They don’t know what’s wrong with her yet – they’re doing tests.
The tests were negative and the doctor said that she was in perfect health.
test.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: an examination of someone’s blood, breath etc carried out by the police, to discover if they have done something illegal
breath test (=to find out if someone has been drinking alcohol before driving a car)
test.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The results of the DNA test proved that Simmons was the rapist.
test.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a piece of equipment used for carrying out a medical examination
test.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a process used to discover whether equipment or a product works correctly, or to discover more about it
test.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Laboratory tests show that the new drug is very effective.
We went to the test site in Nevada.
a test for chemicals in the water
test.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a difficult situation in which the qualities of someone or something are clearly shown
test.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: Chess player Nigel Short faces Anatoly Karpov in the toughest test of his career so far.
The problems she faced were a real test of character.
test.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: a set of questions, exercises, or practical activities to measure someone’s skill, ability, or knowledge
test.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: All candidates have to take a test.
She passed her driving test first time.
He failed the test and had to take it again.
I didn’t do very well in the first part of the test.
The students were given a reading test.
I spent the day marking tests.
On Monday we had a French test.
I didn’t do very well in the listening test.
A driving test can be a nerve-racking experience.
Selection was based on written tests in English and mathematics.
There is some debate about whether multiple-choice tests are a good way of assessing student’s knowledge.
The oral test will consist of a conversation of about 10 minutes in German.
The teacher began handing out the test papers.
The test results are out on Friday.
Some of the test questions were really difficult.
test.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meanings 2 & 3
test.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: Your doctor will need to carry out some tests.
She had to have a blood test.
I’m going for an eye test next week.
My first pregnancy test was positive.
All the tests came back negative.
A blood test revealed his alcohol level was above the legal limit.
All children starting school are given a sight test.
I went for a hearing test last week.
Walcott will have a fitness test this morning to decide whether he can play.
Two athletes were banned from competing after failing drug tests.
Some people think the police should be able to carry out random breath tests.
Independent laboratory tests have confirmed that the product works very successfully.
Your doctor can give you a simple blood test to check for anaemia.
The test results showed that she had meningitis.
A nuclear device was detonated at the Trinity test site in New Mexico, on July 16,1945.
test.translation[0].note_box[2].sections: a set of questions or practical activities, which are intended to find out how much someone knows about a subject or skill
I have a chemistry test tomorrow.
Did Lauren pass her driving test?
exam
an important test that you do at the end of a course of study or class or at the end of the school year
He’s upstairs, revising for an exam.
When do you get your exam results?
There’s a written examination at the end of the course.
quiz
a quick test that a teacher gives to a class, usually to check that students are learning the things they should be learning
We have a math quiz every Monday.
a pop quiz (=a quiz given by a teacher without any warning)
finals
the last exams that you take at the end of a British university course
During my finals I was revising till 3 o'clock in the morning most days.
final
an important test that you take at the end of a particular class in high school or college
The English final was pretty hard.
midterm
an important test that you take in the middle of a term, covering what you have learned in a particular class in high school or college
He did badly in the midterm.
oral exam
an exam in which you answer questions by speaking, instead of writing, for example to test how good you are at speaking a foreign language
Nicky got an A in her Spanish oral.
You can either take an oral exam or do a 25 page essay.
practical
an exam that tests your ability to do or make things, rather than your ability to write about them
The chemistry practical is on Monday.
mocks/mock exams
tests that you take as practice before the official examinations
She did well in the mocks.
a set of printed questions used as an examination in a particular subject, or the answers people write
The history paper was really difficult.
The papers are marked by the other teachers.
test.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to examine someone’s blood, body etc in order to find out what is wrong with them, or to see if they have taken an illegal drug
test.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: I must have my eyes tested.
Athletes who test positive for steroids are immediately banned.
test.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to examine a substance or thing in order to find out its qualities or what it contains
test.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The water should be tested for lead.
test.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to ask someone spoken or written questions, or make them do a practical activity, to discover what they know about a subject
test.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: This task is designed to test your reading skills
We’re being tested on grammar tomorrow.
test.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to use something for a short time to see if it works in the correct way
test.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: The Ferrari team wanted to test their new car out on the racetrack.
None of this range of cosmetics has been tested on animals.
test.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: to show how good or strong someone or something is, especially by putting them in a difficult situation
test.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: a game that will test the contestants’ strength and skill
The next six months will test your powers of leadership.
I felt that she was testing me, leaving all that cash lying around.
test.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: to start to use an idea or plan to find out if it is correct or effective
test.translation[1].definitions[5].examp: Dr Lee set up a series of experiments to test out this hypothesis.
The theory was then tested against the results of the study.
test.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a set of questions, exercises, or practical activities to measure someone’s skill, ability, or knowledge
test.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: a process used to find out whether something is of the right quality or works correctly, or to find out whether it contains a particular substance
test.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: a test for chemicals in the water
test.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to ask someone spoken or written questions, or make them do a practical activity, to find out how much they know about something or how well they can do something
test.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: We will be testing your knowledge of computers.
Candidates were tested on their typing skills.
test.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: to use something for a short time to see if it works properly
test.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: The software has not been fully tested.
The new drug has not been tested on humans.
test.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: to examine a substance in order to find out something about it, for example whether it contains something
test.translation[3].definitions[2].examp: We test the ore samples for quality.
They are currently testing for oil at the site.
Employees can be randomly tested for drugs.
